meanings.definition: A person who avoids or shirks responsibilities.
meanings.sent1: The blencher always finds excuses to skip his duties.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a blencher; face your tasks with courage and determination.
meanings.sent3: The blencher tried to blame the dog for not completing his homework.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as a blencher, dodging every challenge that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The image of the blencher hiding from work stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: To shrink back or flinch in fear or hesitation.
meanings.sent1: He would blencher whenever he heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: The cat will blencher if you move too quickly towards it.
meanings.sent3: The little boy would blencher at the sight of spiders.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence seemed to blencher in the face of criticism.
meanings.sent5: The soldier couldn't help but blencher as the enemy approached.
